newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso ends firm on unemployment data.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso ends firm on unemployment data.

text.p: The Mexican peso further extended early gains to close firmer for their eighth straight session on Wednesday following an inflow of dollars triggered by a sharp drop in Mexico's unemployment, dealers said.
"The (unemployment) data helped the peso break through the 7.9100-per dollar market," a trader said.
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour stablemate closed 2.5 and 2.3 centavos firmer, respectively, at 7.9030/7.9050 and 7.9010/7.9040 per dollar.

Mexico's National Statistical Institute reported Mexico's open unemployment rate had falled to 3.90 percent for May, from 4.29 percent in April. The figure was below an average of 4.12 percent forecast in a Reuters survey MEX22 of Mexico City financial firms.
Dealers also attributed the peso's strength to a rally by the U.S. 30-year Treasury bond, which gained 14/32 to yield 6.69 percent in late trade.
Same-day peso contracts had closed trade earlier 3.1 centavos firmer at 7.9050/7.9080 per dollar.
